item.title: Burnley vs Brighton, Premier League: Prediction, what time, what channel, how to stream online, team news, odds and more - The Independent
item.description:
Burnley vs Brighton, Premier League: Prediction, what time, what channel, how to stream online, team news, odds and more  The Independent

A Burnley side struggling for form welcome Brighton to Turf Moor on Saturday afternoon. Sean Dyche’s team lost in midweek after surrendering a one-goal lead against Liverpool, and are without a win in eight league games; they come into the weekend in 19th place on nine points. Brighton have had an excellent start to the season, and their 3-1 win against rivals Crystal Palace in midweek after going a man down will only add to the feel-good factor on the south coast; they’re in 10th, on 21 points. What time does it start? Burnley vs Brighton kicks off at 3:00pm (GMT) on Saturday 8th December....

item.title: Wolves vs Chelsea: Maurizio Sarri tears into over-confident Blues after second straight away defeat - The Independent
item.description:
Wolves vs Chelsea: Maurizio Sarri tears into over-confident Blues after second straight away defeat  The Independent

An angry Maurizio Sarri rounded on his over-confident Chelsea stars after their title hopes suffered another major blow with a 2-1 defeat at Wolves. Raul Jimenez and Diogo Jota struck in four second half minutes to stun the visitors who now sit 10 points behind Premier League leaders Manchester City. Ruben Loftus-Cheek's deflected opener had put the visitors in control before they slipped to a second straight away defeat after gifting Wolves a way back. Chelsea, who sit fourth, host leaders City on Saturday and Sarri was annoyed at their complacency. Read more - Jota and Jimenez stun Chelse...

item.title: Chelsea fall 10 points behind Man City as 18-year-old Morgan Gibbs-White shines for victorious Wolves - The Telegraph
item.description:
Chelsea fall 10 points behind Man City as 18-year-old Morgan Gibbs-White shines for victorious Wolves  The Telegraph

There are ten points now between his Chelsea team and the Premier League leaders Manchester City and if Maurizio Sarri had his doubts about the task facing him then this second defeat of the season will have opened his eyes about more than one of his big name players. It was a magnificent night for Wolverhampton Wanderers and their manager Nuno Espirito Santo who dared to be brave in his selection, especially with the 18-year-old English boy Morgan Gibbs-White and was rewarded. His Wolves team scored two second half goals in the space of four minutes to clinch a victory but Chelsea, with ov...

item.title: Diogo Jota and Raul Jimenez stun Chelsea to earn Wolves memorable win - The Independent
item.description:
Diogo Jota and Raul Jimenez stun Chelsea to earn Wolves memorable win  The Independent

Wolves staged a stirring Molineux comeback to make Chelsea pay heavily for missed chances as Kepa Arrizabalaga’s goalkeeping error cost the Blues. Maurizio Sarri’s men looked relatively untroubled for 59 minutes and led through a goal from Ruben Loftus-Cheek. But Kepa allowed a Raul Jimenez shot to creep past him on 59 minutes to trigger a memorable Wolves fightback that was completed when Diogo Jota side-footed home from a Matt Doherty cross. Chelsea, though, should have wrapped up victory for Kepa’s howler with Wolves goalkeeper Rui Patricio making a superb save from Willian while Alvora ...

item.title: Chelsea hopeful Ruben Loftus-Cheek will stay after first Premier League start in 21 months - The Telegraph
item.description:
Chelsea hopeful Ruben Loftus-Cheek will stay after first Premier League start in 21 months  The Telegraph

Chelsea are hopeful that they can persuade Ruben Loftus-Cheek that his future lies at the club this season and beyond after his first league start and goal in the surprise defeat to Wolverhampton Wanderers on Wednesday night. The 22-year-old has been weighing his options over a loan move in January and with his contract expiring in 2021 there is a feeling that he will soon have to make a big call on whether to stay at the club he joined as an eight-year-old. The start against Wolves was his first in the league for Chelsea since April 2016 and a small but significant show of faith in the pla...

item.title: Maurizio Sarri questions Chelsea players’ attitude after Wolves defeat - The Guardian
item.description:
Maurizio Sarri questions Chelsea players’ attitude after Wolves defeat  The Guardian

Maurizio Sarri questioned the attitude of his Chelsea players and accused some of over-confidence after they suffered a chastening 2-1 defeat at Wolves that leaves them 10 points behind Manchester City, the Premier League leaders, before Saturday’s meeting between the two clubs at Stamford Bridge. After taking the lead through Ruben Loftus-Cheek, Chelsea conceded twice in four second-half minutes, with Sarri dismayed at the way his players reacted to Raúl Jiménez’s equaliser. The Italian admitted he was “really worried” by what he had seen thereafter as Wolves turned the game on its head th...

item.title: Wolves vs Chelsea - Premier League preview: Prediction, odds, how to watch on TV and live stream - The Independent
item.description:
Wolves vs Chelsea - Premier League preview: Prediction, odds, how to watch on TV and live stream  The Independent

Chelsea will wonder how they are 10 points behind City already this season. They can reduce the gap down to seven with a win at Molineux, but 31 points at this stage of any other campaign would have Chelsea much closer to the top. As it stands, the Blues’ objective is going to be to fend off Arsenal and Tottenham below them to ensure Champions League football is back at the Bridge next season. Four defeats in their last five games is a surprise for Wolves who have a wealth of talent in their squad. Even more surprising was the consecutive defeats against Huddersfield and fellow promoted sid...

item.title: Liverpool come from behind to beat Burnley maintain unbeaten start - The Telegraph
item.description:
Liverpool come from behind to beat Burnley maintain unbeaten start  The Telegraph

Liverpool march on, still unbeaten, still breathing down Manchester City’s expensive collars. And they keep creating records as they go. Victory at Burnley meant they have thus far this season produced 12 wins and three draws, their best return from the first 15 games in a top-flight season. And all this while giving the reserves a run-out. Sadio Mane and Andy Robertson had both been injured in the Merseyside derby and were absent. With Jurgen Klopp deciding to rest both Mohamed Salah and Roberto Firmino, and leading his line with Divock Origi and Daniel Sturridge, the question was whether ...

item.title: Bolton Wanderers players call on PFA for help with November wages still unpaid - The Telegraph
item.description:
Bolton Wanderers players call on PFA for help with November wages still unpaid  The Telegraph

Bolton Wanderers’ players have called in the Professional Footballers’ Association after their wages row plunged the Championship strugglers into further turmoil. Phil Parkinson’s squad have still not been paid their salaries for November, nearly a week after the scheduled date of last Friday, and the issue was unresolved on Thursday night ahead of Saturday’s game at league leaders Norwich. Bolton’s players went on strike in July after bonuses were unpaid, boycotting a friendly against St Mirren, and this latest development raises the prospect of more unrest for manager Parkinson, whose sid...

item.title: Marcos Alonso insists Chelsea must ignore Premier League title gap ahead of Manchester City showdown - The Independent
item.description:
Marcos Alonso insists Chelsea must ignore Premier League title gap ahead of Manchester City showdown  The Independent

Marcos Alonso has urged Chelsea to forget about the growing gap to Manchester City, with the Blues' Premier League title hopes hanging by a thread. Wednesday's shock 2-1 defeat against Wolves at Molineux left Maurizio Sarri's side 10 points behind the Premier League leaders ahead of Saturday's showdown with Pep Guardiola's side at Stamford Bridge. Suffer a third loss of the season and the Blues, who now sit fourth, will trail City by 13 points but Alonso is eager to ignore the table. “It's too early to talk about it, obviously,” Alonso said. “If we lose we are going to be 13 points from the...

item.title: English Premier League Week 16 Review: 5 Things We Learned - Forbes
item.description:
English Premier League Week 16 Review: 5 Things We Learned  Forbes

Wolves’ Diogo Jota celebrates after scoring his side’s second goal during the win over Chelsea. His was one of 33 goals in the midweek fixtures. (ASSOCIATED PRESS Photo/Rui Vieira). From the glut of goals to the team who need their new manager to start with a bang, here are five things we learned from the midweek Premier League action. Goals galore The midweek fixtures brought 33 goals and, according to Opta, it was the first Premier League matchday in which all 20 teams have scored a goal since November 2010. Without a winter break, December is a very busy month for Premier League teams an...

item.title: As Morgan Gibbs-White makes Premier League debut, how are England's other U17s World Cup winners progressing? - The Telegraph
item.description:
As Morgan Gibbs-White makes Premier League debut, how are England's other U17s World Cup winners progressing?  The Telegraph

Wolves manager Nuno Espirito Santo's bold decision to hand Morgan Gibbs-White his full Premier League debut last night against Chelsea paid off handsomely. The 18-year-old flourished in a false 9 as Wolves handed Maurizio Sarri his second defeat in three league matches as Chelsea manager. Our chief football writer, Sam Wallace, who was at Molineux last night, wrote that the teenager "gave Wolves a directness and unpredictability in attack where he was given license to run from deep with the ball". In just over a year, Gibbs-White has progressed from an England U17s World Cup winner to one o...

item.title: Chelsea team news: Mateo Kovacic and Marcos Alonso doubts for Wolves Premier League match - The Independent
item.description:
Chelsea team news: Mateo Kovacic and Marcos Alonso doubts for Wolves Premier League match  The Independent

Mateo Kovacic and Marcos Alonso are doubts for Chelsea's Premier League clash at Wolverhampton Wanderers on Wednesday. Midfielder Kovacic has an ankle problem and Alonso has a back complaint, with both set to be assessed before kick-off. Blues head coach Maurizio Sarri may rotate his options in the second of nine games in December, so Ruben Loftus-Cheek could make his first Premier League start of the season. Chelsea vs PAOK player ratings - 11 show all Chelsea vs PAOK player ratings - 1/11 Kepa Arrizabalaga - 6 REUTERS - 2/11 Davide Zappacosta - 6 EPA - 3/11 Andreas Christensen - 6 REUTERS...

item.title: FA Cup: Wrexham take Newport County to replay after draw - The Guardian
item.description:
FA Cup: Wrexham take Newport County to replay after draw  The Guardian

Wrexham became only the second non-league side to make it into the FA Cup third round draw by securing a goalless draw against Newport County. The fifth tier team ensured a replay against the League Two side, despite the fact their manager Sam Ricketts was told to stay away from the match following speculation that he is set to be appointed as John Askey’s replacement at Shrewsbury Town. Anthony Wordsworth’s sublime goal helped AFC Wimbledon see off non-league Halifax and book their spot in the draw. The National League side came within inches of taking the lead after 19 minutes. Matty Kosy...

item.title: Leeds snatch win after Pablo Hernández sinks Sheffield United with gift goal - The Guardian
item.description:
Leeds snatch win after Pablo Hernández sinks Sheffield United with gift goal  The Guardian

Pablo Hernández snatched victory for Leeds to earn a third straight league win and halt Sheffield United’s eight-match unbeaten run on home soil. Hernández will not score an easier goal this season, sweeping home after an error by Dean Henderson, the goalkeeper on loan from Manchester United, who gifted the ball away after reaching an overhit backpass by John Egan. This was not the bedlam many had hoped would ensue but it was another great advert for the Championship, though the hosts will feel hard done by, having dominated large spells before Henderson’s error eight minutes from time. Rel...

item.title: Chelsea selection for Wolves trip may play role in Ruben Loftus-Cheek's decision to stick or twist - The Telegraph
item.description:
Chelsea selection for Wolves trip may play role in Ruben Loftus-Cheek's decision to stick or twist  The Telegraph

Ruben Loftus-Cheek will decide this month whether or not to request a loan move away from Chelsea, with Maurizio Sarri’s team selection for Wednesday night’s Premier League trip to Wolverhampton Wanderers set to play a pivotal role in his future. Having stepped off the substitutes’ bench to score his fifth goal in six games in all competitions in the victory over Fulham, Loftus-Cheek is hoping to start his first Premier League game of the season against Wolves. Sarri must choose between Loftus-Cheek, Mateo Kovacic, who was forced off with a knock and Ross Barkley, who missed the Fulham game...

item.title: West Brom pegged back by Brentford late show - The Telegraph
item.description:
West Brom pegged back by Brentford late show  The Telegraph

West Brom 1 Brentford 1 It was a night of frustration on two counts for the Championship’s leading scorers, who were held by a stubborn Brentford for 77 minutes before a Harvey Barnes goal broke their resistance, only to concede a stoppage-time equaliser. Barnes fired home his eighth goal of the season, which seemed to make up for some good chances missed earlier in a game dominated by Albion. But then a lapse in concentration just as the match ticked into five minutes of added time cost them victory, substitute Lewis MacLeod rising unmarked to head home an Emiliano Marcondes cross. The poi...

item.title: Neil Warnock savours the perfect 70th birthday present as Cardiff’s win over Wolves lifts them out of bottom three - The Independent
item.description:
Neil Warnock savours the perfect 70th birthday present as Cardiff’s win over Wolves lifts them out of bottom three  The Independent

Neil Warnock saluted the character of his Cardiff City squad after their comeback win over Wolves gave him the perfect 70th birthday present. Warnock had said before the game that what he really wanted for his milestone birthday was three points in the battle against Premier League relegation. The Cardiff manager turns 70 today and he got his wish as second-half goals from Aron Gunnarsson and Junior Hoilett took the Bluebirds out of the bottom three and up to 15th place. Read more - Stunning Hoilett strike claws hosts out of the bottom three “I thanked the players for letting me have a nice...

item.title: Anthony Knockaert: ‘I was staring into the abyss. I was afraid of what might happen’ - The Guardian
item.description:
Anthony Knockaert: ‘I was staring into the abyss. I was afraid of what might happen’  The Guardian

“There was a moment when I began crying and I just couldn’t stop,” Anthony Knockaert says, thinking back to last December and the moment he realised he needed to seek help. The winger was at the Brighton players’ Christmas party and it all became too much for him. Related: Huddersfield v Brighton: match preview On the surface, everything was going superbly for Knockaert. He had played a big part in getting the club promoted to the Premier League and was playing regularly in a competition he watched as a young boy growing up in France. It should have been the best of times but it was the wor...

item.title: Junior Hoilett’s stunner grabs comeback victory for Cardiff against Wolves - The Guardian
item.description:
Junior Hoilett’s stunner grabs comeback victory for Cardiff against Wolves  The Guardian

On the eve of his 70th birthday, Neil Warnock could not have scripted it any better. Love him or loathe him, it is impossible not to admire Warnock’s longevity and this was another victory for the Yorkshireman to cherish as Junior Hoilett produced a moment of individual brilliance to give his manager the perfect present and lift Cardiff out of the relegation zone. Trailing to Matt Doherty’s first-half goal, Cardiff showed spirit and character in abundance to come from behind and win at home for the third time this season. They are a Warnock team in every sense in that respect and it is star...

item.title: Cardiff City hand manager Neil Warnock early birthday gift with comeback victory over Wolves - The Telegraph
item.description:
Cardiff City hand manager Neil Warnock early birthday gift with comeback victory over Wolves  The Telegraph

Neil Warnock turns 70 on Saturday but will feel like a giddy schoolboy thanks to this dream birthday present from his fighting Cardiff City side. This was an all-action fightback that typified the very best of the long-serving manager’s 50 years in the game. Second-half goals from Aron Gunnarsson and a right-footed pearler from Junior Hoilett turned this game on its head and pulled the carpet from a Wolves team on an increasingly miserable run of results. What a sweet night for Warnock, who becomes just the fourth manager to lead a Premier League club at such a grand old age. “You tend to f...

item.title: Huddersfield investigate allegations of homophobic abuse directed against Brighton fans - The Independent
item.description:
Huddersfield investigate allegations of homophobic abuse directed against Brighton fans  The Independent

Huddersfield have launched an investigation into reports of homophobic abuse during Saturday's home defeat to Brighton. The Huddersfield Town LGBT supporters group, Proud Terriers, have claimed homophobic chanting was aimed at Brighton's travelling fans during the Terriers' defeat. The West Yorkshire club have said any fans found to have been involved in the abuse will be banned from the John Smith's Stadium. - Read more Andone clinches Brighton comeback against ten-man Terriers "The club is aware of reports of homophobic abuse at (Saturday's) game against Brighton," Huddersfield said in a ...

item.title: Cardiff City vs Wolves: Stunning Junior Hoilett strike claws hosts out of the bottom three - The Independent
item.description:
Cardiff City vs Wolves: Stunning Junior Hoilett strike claws hosts out of the bottom three  The Independent

Junior Hoilett scored a magnificent winner as Cardiff City came from behind to give their manager Neil Warnock every reason to celebrate his 70th birthday this weekend. The Canadian struck a sweet, curling shot 11 minutes from the end of a frenetic game which Wolves had looked in control of when Matt Doherty put them ahead. But Aron Gunnarsson’s equaliser fuelled Cardiff’s belief they could claim their third win in their last four home games. For Wolves, the momentum swing is firmly in the other direction. This was their fifth defeat in six matches and they have picked just a point from the...
